newsitem.title: FRANCE: KLM KLM AS plans cargo sub-hub in eastern France.
newsitem.headline: KLM KLM AS plans cargo sub-hub in eastern France.

text.p: KLM Royal Dutch Airlines Cargo said on Tuesday it was planning to create a freighter sub-hub in eastern France.
"Our objective is to set-up a sub-hub serving France, Switzerland, Germany, northern Italy and Luxembourg, offering direct freighter connections to the Far East and the U.S.

"This would take the pressure off our Amsterdam Schiphol hub while at the same time realising important economies of scale and providing greater proximity in terms of customer service," KLM Cargo's Paris-based operations manager, Southern Europe, Simon Groenenboom, told Reuters.
The sub-hub could start begin first-phase operations by 1999 with a full-term objective being an annual throughput of 30,000-50,000 onnes, Groenenboom said.
He declined to comment on the specific sites under consideration.
"We expect to make our choice of location for the freighter sub-hub by September 1997."
